page.title: 14CHILDREN IN PLYMTREE
page.content: Most of the children in Plymtree go to the very happy, rapidly growing Primary School where they are not only educated in the traditional sense, but also learn to sing, to play music, to act and to join in fully with their community. They have a Sunday School and a Brownie Pack, a Playgroup and a Mother & Toddler Group, and in the Summer Holidays the Church and Chapel run a Fun Club for them to learn about Jesus. This year they have helped the School by raising money in a Fun Run; the famine victims in Ethiopia by helping send 6 sacks of food and toys- the Brownies also raised Â£47 for Ethiopia by selling cups of tea for 10p each; and handicapped children by raising over Â£25 by washing cars for 50p each + one group even washed an aeroplane and raised Â£50...Just a few things that Plymtree children do!
